Detailed Description

This Class adds some Methods for searching in the octree: * by maximal radius * k Nearest

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Do not allow any Objects of this type. So the constructor is private.

Member Function Documentation

std::set< OctreeUtilities::RobotRef > OctreeUtilities::get_nearest_robots ( const boost::shared_ptr< Octree > &  octree,
const Vector3d &  pos,
const RobotRef &  id,
std::size_t  num_nearest 
) [static]

Returns the num_nearest robots relative to a point. To speed up the computation this works on the octree used by some View Objects.

Parameters:
octree The Octree in which all robots are saved.
pos The position for which to calculate the nearest robots
num_nearest The number of nearest robots to find
Returns:
A set of Roboter Identifiers

std::set< OctreeUtilities::RobotRef > OctreeUtilities::get_visible_robots_by_radius ( const boost::shared_ptr< Octree > &  octree,
const Vector3d &  pos,
float  view_radius 
) [static]

Returns the robots which have a distance to the point 'pos' at most view_radius. To speed up the computation this works on an octree used by some View Objects.

Parameters:
octree The octree to work on
pos The position to calculate the distance from
view_radius The maximal distance from the point pos
Returns:
A set of Robot Identifiers.

void OctreeUtilities::get_nearest_robots_Rec ( const boost::shared_ptr< Octree > &  octree,
const Vector3d &  pos,
std::size_t  num_nearest,
PriorityQueue< RobotRef >::Type &  queue,
const RobotRef &  id 
) [static, private]

Does the real work for computing the nearest robots.

Parameters:
octree The octree to work on
pos The position to calculate the nearest robots for.
num_nearest The number of robots to find.
queue A Max Heap with the already found robots. New Robots will be added to this Heap.
id the id of the Robot, so we can distinguish the robot from the other
